meta.title: Remote Learning - Public Prep

meta.name: google-site-verification

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection1847 fsHasTheme2 district

li.a: PrePrep: the Joan Ganz Cooney Early Learning Program
Girls Prep Lower East Side Elementary
Girls Prep Lower East Side Middle
Reject the soft bigotry of low expectations clone- part 2
Reject the soft bigotry of low expectations
If not us, who will make humans human?
How the emergence of the white underclass could improve education for all
White kids can't read, either (and other unacknowledged truths)
The diminishing significance of racism and poverty in education reform
From "16 and Pregnant" to "Teen Mom" to "30 Something Grandma"
Who's your daddy? A question for education reformers
Should Schools Promote the Success Sequence? Why or Why Not?
"Lord knows I love my kids": Poverty, family formation, and the future of education reform
Poverty, family formation, and the future of education reform clone
Education 20/20 Speaker Series: Michael Barone And Ian Rowe
Overcoming Adversity, Not Leaning On It

div.div: Public Prep is the nation’s only non-profit network that exclusively develops exceptional, tuition-free PreK and single-sex elementary and middle public schools.
Public Prep is comprised of 3 tuition-free single-sex public charter schools across 5 campuses that are open enrollment and can only be entered via a random lottery.

li.a: Girls Prep Lower East Side Elementary
Girls Prep Lower East Side Middle

strong.em: OUR REMOTE LEARNING HOMEBASE HAS MOVED TO GOOGLE CLASSROOM

li.a: Google Meet: How-To Guide for Families

div.p: Click the links below to get an idea of how you can expect your scholar to spend his or her day during remote learning.
Read the THIS GUIDE (Spanish guide HERE) and watch the video below to get step-by-step directions to submit work in Illuminate:

video.div: Your web browser does not support the <video> tag.

div.p: Watch this video to learn how to log into Clever:

ul.li: Google Classroom Guide for Families: Albanian I Arabic I Bengali I Chinese I English I French I Haitian-Creole I Russian I Spanish I Korean I Urdu
Google Classroom Tutorial Videos: English I Spanish I Wolof

div.p: All of our classrooms across Public Prep Academies launched Google Classroom this week! We are thrilled that all of our scholars will have access to this tool for connecting with teachers and completing assignments. Many of you have heard from your Principal and teachers about this resource. This email serves as a recap of our norms and expectations around Google Classroom.

Beginning Monday, April 6th, we will also utilize Google Classroom to track attendance. Everyday, all scholars are expected to log into Google Classroom by entering their school email address and password via the google sign-in page. Click on the nine dot icon in the top right corner and choose the google classroom application. If you are previously logged into google from the day prior it is critical that you log out and then back in so the daily attendance is properly captured. Logging in will count as attendance for the day.

p.em: Logging in and out of Google Classroom Daily

ul.li: Logging in: Scholars will utilize their Public Prep google email and password provided to them by their teacher. Please reach out to your scholar’s teacher to confirm you have this critical information.

Logging out: At the end of each day please make sure your scholar logs out of their google classroom account by clicking on your profile icon in the top right corner and clicking “ Sign out of all accounts.” This will ensure that when your scholar logs in the following day there is a proper record for attendance tracking.

div.p: Scholars are expected to log in every single day to at least say they are present. Those that do not have internet connectivity or access to an internet-based device should alert their scholar’s teacher as soon as possible.
Following spring break, Google Classroom will be your starting point for all of your scholar’s assignments.

h2.a: Google Meet: How-To Guide for Families

p.meta: While class is not in session during spring break, we want to make sure the learning doesn’t stop! You can find optional activities and enrichment opportunities, by grade, below. Spring break is also a great chance for your scholar to catch up on any missed assignments since remote learning started. You can still access all previous work packets on this page.

div.p: We are here for you during time off from school:

li.meta: Emails to closures@publicprep.org will be responded to daily.

ul.li: The main Public Prep phone line will be monitored: 212-346-6000.
Emergency support office hours will be provided by appointment on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.

p.meta: Please remember that the health and safety of all of our scholars and families is our top priority! You can find helpful health, food and wellness resources on the resources page of our website HERE. We’ll continue to update as we come across additional useful resources (we’ve added many that you’ve posted to our school’s Facebook groups as well!).
